snippet: In a case that could affect undocumented immigrants, lawmakers are fighting the destruction of personal information for nearly one million people who applied for the city-issued cards....
abstract: Justice Philip G Minardo of New York State Supreme Court on Staten Island bars New York City from destroying records associated with municipal identification card applications until hearing can be convened in January; suit was filed by Republican State Assembly members Ronald Castorina Jr and Nicole Malliotakis, who say records should be kept for national security reasons.
lead_paragraph: In a case that could affect undocumented immigrants, lawmakers are fighting the destruction of personal information for nearly one million people who applied for the city-issued cards.

headline.main: New York City Should Keep ID Data for Now, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: City Must Preserve Data Linked to Municipal IDs for Now, Judge Rules
